greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle by columns: leftmost column = (1, 0, 1, -1, 1, -1, 1,...); columns >1 = (1, 1, 0, 0, 0,...).
comment: As an infinite lower triangular matrix M; M * [1,2,3,...] = A063210: (1, 2, 6, 6, 10, 10, 14, 14,...
M * [1, 3, 5, 7,...] = A047471, {1,3} mod 8. Eigensequence of the triangle = A066983 starting (1, 1, 3, 3, 7, 9, 17, 25,...).
Binomial transform of the triangle = A153861. Row sums = A153284: (1, 1, 3, 1, 3, 1, 3, 1,...).
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 1..100 of triangle, flattened
formula: Triangle by columns: leftmost column = (1, 0, 1, -1, 1,...); columns >1 = (1, 1, 0, 0, 0,...).
